com.yantra.yfc.log

Class YFCLogLevel

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.log4j.Priority
      • org.apache.log4j.Level
        • com.yantra.yfc.log.YFCLogLevel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class YFCLogLevel
extends org.apache.log4j.Level

    The YFCLogLevel defines a certain set of standard logging levels inherited from log4j framework. It is possible to enable different logging levels for the entire application or for specific APIs or agents at runtime without modifying the binary or restarting the application.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • FATAL

        public static final org.apache.log4j.Level FATAL
        The FATAL level designates very severe error events that will presumably lead to the application to abort.

      • ERRORDTL

        public static final org.apache.log4j.Level ERRORDTL
        This level is a custom detail level for statements that relate to errors and need to be displayed as multiple lines. For example, ERRORDTL level can be used to display XMLs and Datamaps.

      • ERROR

        public static final org.apache.log4j.Level ERROR
        The ERROR level is set for statements displaying error as a single line, such as severe runtime errors or unexpected conditions. This is the default logging level for the most stable systems. This level designates error events that might still allow the application to continue running.

      • WARN

        public static final org.apache.log4j.Level WARN
        The WARN level designates potentially harmful situations. These are statements are logged as warning messages.

      • INFO

        public static final org.apache.log4j.Level INFO

        The INFO level designates informational messages that highlight the progress of the application at coarse-grained level. This level can be used conservatively for runtime events such as startup and shutdown. This is the default logging level for initial stage production systems or troubleshooting scenarios.

        Note: This level must NOT be used as markers in code for tracing routine process flows.

      • TIMER

        public static final org.apache.log4j.Level TIMER
        This is a custom level for statements that track or mark the 'process begin' and 'process end' times.

      • SQLDEBUG

        public static final org.apache.log4j.Level SQLDEBUG
        This is a custom level for SQL debug statements.

      • COMMTRACE

        public static final org.apache.log4j.Level COMMTRACE
        This is a custom level for communication-related debugging

      • DEBUG

        public static final org.apache.log4j.Level DEBUG
        The DEBUG level designates fine-grained informational events that are most useful to debug an application. This level can be used widely as markers in code to provide detailed information on the flow of the process.

      • VERBOSE

        public static final org.apache.log4j.Level VERBOSE
        The VERBOSE level is logged for statements that require highly detailed information. This has the lowest possible rank and is intended to turn on all logging. The VERBOSE level is similar to the ALL level in log4j framework. This is used extensively and gives detailed information of system flow.

    • Constructor Detail

      • YFCLogLevel

        protected YFCLogLevel(int level,
                      java.lang.String strLevel,
                      int syslogEquiv)
        This method instantiates a level object. level A number representing the logging level. For example, VERBOSE level is 9000. strLevel The name of the log level. syslogEquiv The system equivalent integer of the log level. For example, VERBOSE has a system log equivalent of 7.

    • Method Detail

      • toLevel

        public static org.apache.log4j.Level toLevel(int val,
                                             org.apache.log4j.Level defaultLevel)
        This method converts an integer val, passed as an argument to a valid Level. If the conversion fails, then this method returns the specified default level passed as an input parameter, defaultLevel. val The integer value of the level. defaultLevel The default level to be returned in the case of conversion failure.

      • toLevel

        public static org.apache.log4j.Level toLevel(java.lang.String sArg,
                                             org.apache.log4j.Level defaultLevel)
        This method converts a string sArg, passed as an argument to a valid Level. If the conversion fails, then this method returns the specified default level passed as an input parameter, defaultLevel. sArg The name of the log level. defaultLevel The default level to be returned in the case of conversion failure.

      • toLevel

        public static org.apache.log4j.Level toLevel(int i)
        This method converts an integer i, passed as an argument to a valid Level. If the conversion fails, then this method returns DEBUG. i The integer value of the level.

      • toLevel

        public static org.apache.log4j.Level toLevel(java.lang.String sArg)
        This method converts a string sArg, passed as an argument to a valid Level. If the conversion fails, then this method returns DEBUG. sArg The name of the log level.
